title: Branches in `oneOf` must be unique
description: `oneOf` is intended for mutually-exclusive alternatives; duplicate schemas make it ambiguous which branch should match.

comprehensiveExamples.title: Wrong: Duplicate identical branches
comprehensiveExamples.description: Having two identical string branches makes oneOf ambiguous.

comprehensiveExamples.title: Wrong: Semantically equivalent branches
comprehensiveExamples.description: Two branches that both accept the same set of instances (e.g., integer vs number with multipleOf:1) are duplicates.

comprehensiveExamples.title: Right: Mutually exclusive by constraint
comprehensiveExamples.description: Branches that cannot both match at once are valid usage of oneOf.

message: Remove or modify duplicate schemas inside `oneOf`.
